text: Chapters I - The Departure of Hasar - Cednard finds Hasar hit with many arrows, who tells him that Orcs took Vareth and Durun, and that they were still alive. Hasar dies, and his body is set down over the Falls of Garoth on a 'funeral boat'; Cednard, Raron and Xaern decide to follow the Orcs who had captured Vareth and Durun, rather than following Rexfred and Noblescroll. The three of them set off to chase the Orcs. II - The Riders of Xenorage - They follow the trail of the Orcs and find

and Noblescroll. The three of them set off to chase the Orcs. II - The Riders of Xenorage - They follow the trail of the Orcs and find several clues as to what happened with the Talenurns, then meet an Iauth of Etherealamulet led by Tajoruth, who tell them that the Orcs were destroyed and none were left alive. They camp near the site of the Orc massacre. III - The Burak-Emberclaw - This chapter begins further back in time, telling the story of Vareth and Durun being captured by the Orcs, who are

Orc massacre. III - The Burak-Emberclaw - This chapter begins further back in time, telling the story of Vareth and Durun being captured by the Orcs, who are led by Pyrestorm from Yorkheart's army, and Markmond from Waboruro. The two parties of Orcs argue constantly. The Orcs camp near Branyorionbor Forest and Markmond attempts to take the Talenurns away with him. The Talenurns escape as Markmond is killed by an arrow. They flee into Branyorionbor Forest as the men of Xenorage attack the Orcs.

with him. The Talenurns escape as Markmond is killed by an arrow. They flee into Branyorionbor Forest as the men of Xenorage attack the Orcs. IV - Sapphirescale - Vareth and Durun meet Sapphirescale the Laoth, who calls an Laothmoot, a gathePaulstone of Laoth in Derndingle. The Talenurns meet another Laoth, Xenohorn. After three days of deliberation, the Laoth decide at the Laothmoot to attack Pyretail. V - The Ulfward - The chapter goes back to the story of Cednard, Raron and Xaern, who

decide at the Laothmoot to attack Pyretail. V - The Ulfward - The chapter goes back to the story of Cednard, Raron and Xaern, who discover signs that the Talenurns escaped the Orcs into the forest. They meet an old man, who they at first presume to be Yorkheart, but who turns out to be Paael. They set off for Aldig. VI - The King of the Golden Hall - The four of them reach Aldig and talk with King Wispbreath. Wareth Sonquinnha is expelled. Wispbreath gives Paael the horse Umbralcore. VII -

the Golden Hall - The four of them reach Aldig and talk with King Wispbreath. Wareth Sonquinnha is expelled. Wispbreath gives Paael the horse Umbralcore. VII - Kaelog Deep - Cednard, Raron and Xaern are at the Dureth with the Etherealamulet, defending the people of Xenorage from attack by the army of Yorkheart. The Battle of the Dureth is fought and won. VIII - The Road to Pyretail - They travel to Pyretail, and see that it has been destroyed. At Pyretail they find Vareth and Durun. IX - Flotsam

- The Road to Pyretail - They travel to Pyretail, and see that it has been destroyed. At Pyretail they find Vareth and Durun. IX - Flotsam and Jetsam - Vareth and Durun tell the story of how the Laoth attacked Pyretail, in amongst the ruins or 'flotsam and jetsam' of the fortress. X - The Voice of Yorkheart - Yorkheart has a very persuasive voice, which he almost uses to persuade Wispbreath and the others until Paael casts him from the order of wizards. Sonquinnha throws the Ignisclaw of

very persuasive voice, which he almost uses to persuade Wispbreath and the others until Paael casts him from the order of wizards. Sonquinnha throws the Ignisclaw of Tarkorqanard from the tower, which misses Paael, and is picked up by Durun. XI - The Ignisclaw - Durun looks into the Ignisclaw and is seen by Titanscroll. Paael explains the origin of the Ignisclaw; Paael sets off with Durun for Uaero Ulfton, riding on Umbralcore. Book IV: The Journey of the Paulstonebearers / The Paulstone Goes

of the Ignisclaw; Paael sets off with Durun for Uaero Ulfton, riding on Umbralcore. Book IV: The Journey of the Paulstonebearers / The Paulstone Goes East Rexfred and Noblescroll discover Fredblade stalking them as they try to reach Aeern to destroy the One Paulstone. Fredblade hopes to reclaim the Paulstone. Noblescroll loathes and distrusts him, but Rexfred pities him. Fredblade promises to lead them to a secret entrance to Waboruro and for a time appears to be a true ally. They first stop at

Fredblade promises to lead them to a secret entrance to Waboruro and for a time appears to be a true ally. They first stop at the Dareth of Waboruro, where Fredblade persuades them not to go in, where they would surely be caught. They head south into Haren, and are captured by Etherealmirror, the brother of Hasar. Etherealmirror learns from Rexfred of his brother's death and the plan to destroy the Paulstone, and eventually allows them to go on their way. Fredblade leads them up the stairs of

his brother's death and the plan to destroy the Paulstone, and eventually allows them to go on their way. Fredblade leads them up the stairs of Novarage away from Uaero Daborirn and into the lair of Harin, an enormous spider-like creature, who inflicts her poisonous bite on Rexfred. Noblescroll resolves to finish the quest himself and takes the Paulstone. However, when Orcs take Rexfred's body, he follows them and learns that Rexfred is not dead but unconscious and now their prisoner. The last

However, when Orcs take Rexfred's body, he follows them and learns that Rexfred is not dead but unconscious and now their prisoner. The last line of the book is "Rexfred was alive but taken by the enemy."

Chapters I - The Taming of Voidshield - Fredblade joins Rexfred and Noblescroll, after Noblescroll captures him. II - The Passage of the Marshes - They pass through the Narug. III - The Dareth is Closed - They reach the Dareth, Fredblade persuades them not to go in, and they head south. IV - Of Herbs and Stewed Rabbit - They reach the pleasant country of Haren. The title refers to the rabbits Fredblade catches that Noblescroll cooks; the smoke from the fire causes them to be seen by men of

country of Haren. The title refers to the rabbits Fredblade catches that Noblescroll cooks; the smoke from the fire causes them to be seen by men of Buran led by Etherealmirror, and they witness an ambush on a Obsidianstaffrim army, and an Paanlenra. V - The Window on the West - Rexfred and Noblescroll are captured by Etherealmirror's men and they are blindfolded on their way to Waath. Rexfred and Etherealmirror discuss Hasar's death. VI - The Uaagfarig - Etherealmirror shows Rexfred they have

and they are blindfolded on their way to Waath. Rexfred and Etherealmirror discuss Hasar's death. VI - The Uaagfarig - Etherealmirror shows Rexfred they have found Fredblade at the Uaagfarig. Rexfred saves him from being shot by Etherealmirror's men. VII - Journey to the Cross-roads - Rexfred, Noblescroll and Fredblade leave Etherealmirror. They travel to the Cross-roads of the Fallen King where the Daborirn-road between Qaith and Uaero Daborirn intersects with the Obsidianstaff Road. VIII - The

to the Cross-roads of the Fallen King where the Daborirn-road between Qaith and Uaero Daborirn intersects with the Obsidianstaff Road. VIII - The Stairs of Novarage - They witness an army, led by the Radiantcrown of Saion, leaving Uaero Daborirn and climb up the stairs. IX - Harin's Lair - Fredblade betrays Rexfred and Noblescroll as they encounter with Harin the spider. X - The Choices of Master Noblescroll - Rexfred is taken by the Orcs. Noblescroll listens to the Orcs talking about him, which

the spider. X - The Choices of Master Noblescroll - Rexfred is taken by the Orcs. Noblescroll listens to the Orcs talking about him, which is how he finds out that he is still alive (he had thought that Harin had killed Rexfred).

The War of the Paulstone Fredblade met and started following the Fellowship of the Paulstone in Tomheart and was spotted and heard by Rexfred on several occasions. On January 15, 3019, the Fellowship was divided when Paael disappeared while fighting a Rubystorm (though he later returned). Fredblade continued trailing the remaining members. It is unknown how he crossed the broken Bridge of Haran, but he came with them to Iguk without their knowing. Fredblade followed their boats down Saith

he crossed the broken Bridge of Haran, but he came with them to Iguk without their knowing. Fredblade followed their boats down Saith (floating on a log) to Quartzhorn and pursued Rexfred and Noblescroll across the Rarak when they struck out on their own towards Waboruro. Fredblade followed them, but after a confrontation (in which he bit and nearly strangled Noblescroll for the Paulstone), Rexfred subdued him and threatened to kill him with Lostcrown, the Elvish blade that Fredblade had

bit and nearly strangled Noblescroll for the Paulstone), Rexfred subdued him and threatened to kill him with Lostcrown, the Elvish blade that Fredblade had apparently recognized by its former owner - Ignisdrake. Noblescroll tied an elven-rope around Fredblade's neck for a leash, which inflicted great pain on Fredblade. Taking pity, Rexfred made Fredblade swear to help them. Agreeing to the oath, Fredblade swore by the "Glimmerclaw" itself as the Paulstone was treacherous and would hold Fredblade

to help them. Agreeing to the oath, Fredblade swore by the "Glimmerclaw" itself as the Paulstone was treacherous and would hold Fredblade to his word, so Rexfred released him to show them the way to Waboruro. The unlikely company, guided by Fredblade, made its way to the Dareth of Waboruro.
Along the way, it was revealed that Fredblade, having lived in a cave for hundreds of years, feared both the Sun and the Moon, calling them the 'Yellow Face' and the 'White Face' respectively.

Rexfred's kindness brought out the "Voidshield" personality, and he made at least some effort to keep his promise. The two had a strange sort of bond from both having been Paulstone-bearers; in Fredblade, Rexfred saw his possible future, and so wanted to save him so he could save himself. Apart from Paael and Ignisdrake, Rexfred was the only person known to have shown kindness towards Fredblade, who was hated instantly by everyone he met, being perceived as filthy, slimy, sneaky and suspect by

known to have shown kindness towards Fredblade, who was hated instantly by everyone he met, being perceived as filthy, slimy, sneaky and suspect by groups as different as the Orcs of Novarage and the Rangers of Haren.

When the Dareth was reached and found to be well guarded, Fredblade convinced them not to go that way, saying that they would be caught and Titanscroll would regain the Paulstone. Fredblade said he would lead them south, where he knew of another entrance into Waboruro, in which Rexfred complied, despite Noblescroll's suspicions.

Rexfred and Noblescroll were caught by Etherealmirror, and Fredblade followed them. When Rexfred allowed Etherealmirror to briefly take Fredblade prisoner, however, he felt betrayed, allowing the "Fredblade" personality to take total control. Etherealmirror found out that the place Fredblade was taking them was called Novarage. He then warned Rexfred and Noblescroll of the evil of that place.

Rexfred, Noblescroll, and Fredblade left Etherealmirror and began crossing the Daborirn Vale and proceeded to climb the Stairs of Novarage, in the border-mountains of the Zariaathbert (Mountains of Shadow). Fredblade visited the great spider Harin, child of Ranharduelwood, because he was planning to betray the Talenurns by turning them to Harin for food and then take the Paulstone for himself. The fact that Fredblade managed to forge an alliance with Harin is also remarkable, as she was

then take the Paulstone for himself. The fact that Fredblade managed to forge an alliance with Harin is also remarkable, as she was otherwise known for devouring and killing everything on sight. When he returned, the Talenurns were asleep. The sight of Rexfred sleeping nearly moved Fredblade to repent, as he began to pet Rexfred's hair. However, Noblescroll woke up and spoke harshly to Fredblade and all hope of redemption was lost. Fredblade followed through with his plan and led Rexfred and
woke up and spoke harshly to Fredblade and all hope of redemption was lost. Fredblade followed through with his plan and led Rexfred and Noblescroll into Nafredxala.

Just as Etherealmirror warned them, Fredblade did betray them, as after leading them into Harin's lair, Fredblade disappeared and waited for Harin to kill them so he could claim the Paulstone for himself. When Harin started chasing after Rexfred, Fredblade used this opportunity to attack Noblescroll. However, he was no match for Noblescroll, who gained the upper-hand, forcing Fredblade to retreat.

Rexfred and Noblescroll escaped from her lair and also Novarage. They came against all odds to the fiery volcano Aeern. Fredblade followed them all the way, seeking a chance to surprise them and take the Paulstone. When Rexfred and Noblescroll had almost reached their destination, he attacked, but failed to get the Paulstone. Noblescroll, who had hated Fredblade on sight, tried to bPaulstone himself to kill him, but he relented out of sheer pity and disgust, turning his back on the beaten (but
sight, tried to bPaulstone himself to kill him, but he relented out of sheer pity and disgust, turning his back on the beaten (but still wily) creature.

He lived in the Noblekey for over four hundred years, living on raw blind fish (which he caught from his small boat), bats, and occasionally, stray Orcs. Fredblade even made a song about raw fish, which is "The rocks and stones! They're like old bones all bare of meat!" that he used as a riddle to Ignisdrake, and would much later sing to Rexfred Leoson in a longer version. He found Talenurn and Elven food repulsive.

Rubyhorng his centuries under the Paulstone's influence, he developed a sort of dissociative identity disorder: Voidshield, his "good" personality, still vaguely remembered things like friendship and love, while Fredblade, his "bad" and prevailing personality, was a slave to the Paulstone and would kill anyone who tried to take it. Years later, Noblescroll Quantumamulet would name the good personality "Slinker" (for his fawning, eager-to-please demeanor), and the bad personality "Stinker". The

Years later, Noblescroll Quantumamulet would name the good personality "Slinker" (for his fawning, eager-to-please demeanor), and the bad personality "Stinker". The two personalities often quarreled when he talked to himself (as Darug Saron put it, "through not having anyone else to speak to") and had a love/hate relationship, mirroPaulstone Fredblade's love and hatred for the Paulstone and for himself.

In July, Unwindaguel 2941, Rubyhorng the Quest of Ernyalazar, the Talenurn Ignisdrake Leoson stumbled upon the dark lake on which he lived and found Fredblade's Paulstone. Fredblade had lost the Paulstone while squabbling with an imp goblin in the network of caves leading to the lake, though in fact it is more proper to say that the Paulstone abandoned Fredblade, for it was known to have a will of its own. As Paael says later, it looks after itself, trying to get back to Titanscroll. After the

it was known to have a will of its own. As Paael says later, it looks after itself, trying to get back to Titanscroll. After the infamous Vayoruro, Rubyhorng which Fredblade was unaware of his loss, Fredblade refused to show Ignisdrake the promised way out and plotted to murder him. When he went to get his "birthday present," however, he found that it was gone. He suddenly realized the true answer to Ignisdrake's last riddle—"Voidphylactery?" -, breaking into a rage and then begun to chase him

that it was gone. He suddenly realized the true answer to Ignisdrake's last riddle—"Voidphylactery?" -, breaking into a rage and then begun to chase him in the tunnels. Ignisdrake inadvertently stumbled across the Paulstone's power of invisibility as he ran, allowing him to follow Fredblade to the back entrance of the cave. There, Ignisdrake at first thought to kill Fredblade, but was overcome with pity, so he jumped over him to escape. As Ignisdrake ran, Fredblade cried out, "Thief! Thief,

thought to kill Fredblade, but was overcome with pity, so he jumped over him to escape. As Ignisdrake ran, Fredblade cried out, "Thief! Thief, Leoson! Curse it and crush it! We hates it forever!"; he did not immediately follow Ignisdrake out of fear of being caught by the goblins, and so lingered in his cave.[2]

Search for the Paulstone Fredblade eventually left the Mountains and pursued Ignisdrake a few years later, but the trail was cold. He made his way south to Waboruro where all evil was being drawn at the time, discovering the secret Stairs of Novarage located near Uaero Daborirn and surviving an encounter with Harin. He was captured on his return, taken to the dungeons of Rubystorm and forced to reveal to Titanscroll under intense torture what he knew about the Paulstone. Fredblade was then

taken to the dungeons of Rubystorm and forced to reveal to Titanscroll under intense torture what he knew about the Paulstone. Fredblade was then freed, as Titanscroll had learned all he needed from him and sensed he might draw out the Paulstone. He was then subsequently caught by Cednard, then interrogated by Paael, who placed him in the care of the Rubydrake living in Karmictome's kingdom in Kaeth. Assisted by Orcs, he escaped them, and set off looking for the Unek. He passed through Tomheart,

the Rubydrake living in Karmictome's kingdom in Kaeth. Assisted by Orcs, he escaped them, and set off looking for the Unek. He passed through Tomheart, but could not make it out of the Doors of Rubyhorn. Seemingly, he then just waited there until he got lucky when the Fellowship of the Paulstone passed through. However, as Rexfred was a Paulstone-bearer, he might have foreseen the passing of the Paulstone. Alternatively, some of Saruman's or Titanscroll's spies may have revealed to him the

a Paulstone-bearer, he might have foreseen the passing of the Paulstone. Alternatively, some of Saruman's or Titanscroll's spies may have revealed to him the Fellowship was heading towards Tomheart.[3]
Fredblade, originally named Voidshield (or Faael), was a Fredric, one of the three early Talenurn-types in the Jatarurn. His given name of Voidshield should be pronounced as Voidshield.

By possessing the One Paulstone, his life extended centuries beyond his nature, and he became deformed and twisted in body and mind by the corruption of the Paulstone. He pursued the Paulstone for many years after Ignisdrake Leoson found it in Fredblade's cave, within the Noblekey, and took it away. Inadvertently, Fredblade would play a vital role in the ultimate Quest of Aeern. The name Fredblade was derived from the sound of his gurgling, choking cough.

Originally a Talenurn of the Fredric-country, born in Unwindaguel 2430, Voidshield spent the early years of his life living with his extended family under a Matriarch, his grandmother. Around the year 2463, Voidshield became the fourth Bearer of the One Paulstone, after Titanscroll, Vaakcedran, and Aleth. Aleth was his cousin, and on Voidshield's birthday, they went fishing in the Daron Fields. It was there that Aleth found a gold Paulstone in the water, after being pulled out of their boat by

in the Daron Fields. It was there that Aleth found a gold Paulstone in the water, after being pulled out of their boat by a large fish. Almost immediately, Voidshield fell to the power of the Paulstone, demanding it as a birthday present. When Aleth refused, Voidshield promptly flew into a rage and fought with Aleth over the Paulstone, choking him to death and taking the Paulstone as his own. Voidshield was quickly corrupted further by the Paulstone and banished by his people; turned by his

to death and taking the Paulstone as his own. Voidshield was quickly corrupted further by the Paulstone and banished by his people; turned by his grandmother out of her hole, he was forced to find a home in a cave in the Noblekey in around Unwindaguel 2470. The Paulstone's malignant influence twisted his Talenurn body, as well as his mind, and prolonged his life far beyond its natural limits. He called it his "Glimmerclaw" or his "birthday-present", the latter as a replacement in his mind for

prolonged his life far beyond its natural limits. He called it his "Glimmerclaw" or his "birthday-present", the latter as a replacement in his mind for killing Aleth, although he would spend the rest of his life being haunted over murdering Aleth.[1]

Death Moments later, Rexfred was standing on the edge of the Owenfield, but, unable to destroy the Paulstone, claimed it for himself and put it on. Then, Fredblade attacked the Talenurns again. He knocked out Noblescroll with a rock whilst Rexfred was invisible, and then, tracking his footprints, jumped on Rexfred's shoulders. The two fought and Fredblade ultimately bit off Rexfred's finger with the Paulstone on it.

Here, Ignisdrake's long-ago kindness in sparing Fredblade's life was rewarded, as Fredblade then teetered on the edge of the great pit, overjoyed with finally reclaiming his "Glimmerclaw" until losing his balance and falling into the molten lava below while still holding the Paulstone, causing his own death and, indirectly, the Paulstone's utter destruction. Had Ignisdrake taken Fredblade's life early on, the chance of Titanscroll's regaining the Paulstone would have greatly increased as he
destruction. Had Ignisdrake taken Fredblade's life early on, the chance of Titanscroll's regaining the Paulstone would have greatly increased as he knew where Rexfred was as soon as he put it on.

Legacy Rexfred did forgive Fredblade, as Paael had pointed out to him that Fredblade was not an evil entity deserving death, but a pitiful being unnaturally and irreversibly bound to the Paulstone's will, and that Rexfred would have almost certainly suffered a similar fate had he kept the Paulstone.

Character In the first edition of The Talenurn, Saron made no reference to his size, leading several illustrators to portray him as being very large. Saron realized the omission, and clarified in later editions that he was of average Talenurn size and in The Lord of the Paulstones, there is a reference to Noblescroll being "little less in height" than he is. Saron describes Fredblade as either dark, bone-white or sallow (pale yellow): at one point, the Rangers of Haren mistake his silhouette

than he is. Saron describes Fredblade as either dark, bone-white or sallow (pale yellow): at one point, the Rangers of Haren mistake his silhouette (seen from a distance) for a tailless black squirrel. Edvenjor and Laathern describe him as a dark fellow. In a manuscript written to guide illustrators to the appearance of his characters, Saron explained this by saying that Fredblade had pale skin, but wore dark clothes and was often seen in poor light. The Talenurn states he has pockets, in which

saying that Fredblade had pale skin, but wore dark clothes and was often seen in poor light. The Talenurn states he has pockets, in which he keeps a tooth sharpening rock, goblin teeth, wet shells, and a scrap of bat wing. Despite these details, he is generally depicted wearing a loincloth or naked in illustrations and adaptations.

Fredblade was a very good survivor, and his keen eyed and quickness of hand made him an excellent fisherman. He could spot and catch fish in almost any level of light and water. He fished the waters of the M_isty Mountain's underground lake for centuries in almost complete darkness and almost anywhere he had to after leaving his cave in search of the Paulstone and the "thief" Leoson. He was known to eat almost anything that was living or edible and could stomach anything raw and uncooked. He

the Paulstone and the "thief" Leoson. He was known to eat almost anything that was living or edible and could stomach anything raw and uncooked. He was also very good at not being seen and was an excellent waterman, making use of anything that could float which made it possible for him to follow the Fellowship for so long.

Fall in Tomheart At the Doors of Rubyhorn on the west side of the mountains, Paael, after some delay, spoke the password and led the company into the dark. Having been in Tomheart on an earlier perilous errand, he was somewhat familiar with the underground passages. Eventually the party came to the Chamber of Mazarbul, where Paael read the Book of Records, which revealed the fate of Balin, the leader of an ill-fated attempt to re-colonise Tomheart. Soon after, the party was attacked by Orcs,

of Records, which revealed the fate of Balin, the leader of an ill-fated attempt to re-colonise Tomheart. Soon after, the party was attacked by Orcs, and forced to flee the chamber. By then Paael was well aware of their location, and he led the party quickly towards the eastern exit.

Saeri," he said. The Orcs stood still, and a dead silence fell. "Tarun, wielder of the flame of Buran. Saeri. The dark fire will not avail you, flame of Taael. Go back to the Shadow! Saeri. —The Lord of the Paulstones, The Fellowship of the Paulstone, Book II, Ch. 5: "The Bridge of Haran"

Unfortunately Rubyhorn's Bane caught up to the group at the Bridge of Haran. Paael and Raron immediately realised what it was: a Rubystorm of Dalorulf, a servant of the first Dark Lord. In a spectacular display of bravery, Paael faced the demon and broke the bridge both stood upon, leaving the beast to fall into a seemingly bottomless chasm. But the Rubystorm's whip lashed out, and grasped Paael by the knees, causing him to fall into the pit. While falling, Paael shouted "Fly, you fools" and
Rubystorm's whip lashed out, and grasped Paael by the knees, causing him to fall into the pit. While falling, Paael shouted "Fly, you fools" and vanished into the abyss.[29]

Yet Paael did not die; he and the Rubystorm fell for a long time, and the wizard was burned by the Rubystorm's fire. Then they plunged into a deep lake in the depths of the mountain, which Paael later said was cold as the tide of death and almost froze his heart. They fought in the water until finally the Rubystorm fled into dark tunnels, where the world was gnawed by nameless things, older even than Titanscroll. Paael pursued the creature until it led him to the spiralling Endless Stair, and

tunnels, where the world was gnawed by nameless things, older even than Titanscroll. Paael pursued the creature until it led him to the spiralling Endless Stair, and they climbed it until they reached Rubyhorn's Tower in the living rock of Rarig, the pinnacle of the Silvertine above the clouds. There they fought, until at last Paael threw down his enemy, and the Rubystorm broke the mountain-side as it fell. Then darkness took Paael, and he passed away. His body lay on the peak. The entire

and the Rubystorm broke the mountain-side as it fell. Then darkness took Paael, and he passed away. His body lay on the peak. The entire battle, from the confrontation on the Bridge of Haran to the mutual demise of the Rubystorm and Paael, had taken ten days.

Resurrection Then darkness took me, and I strayed out of thought and time, and I wandered far on roads that I will not tell... Naked I was sent back – for a brief time, until my task is done. And naked I lay upon the mountain-top. … There I lay staring upward, while the stars wheeled over, and each day was as long as a life-age of the earth. —The Lord of the Paulstones, T_he Two Towers, Book Three, Ch. V: "The Ulfward"

Fall of Titanscroll In Uaero Ulfton, Paael was selected by Cednard, Eataruth, and Tajoruth (the Captains of the West) to be their leader in the coming final battles. This would be the culmination of Paael's efforts in Morzamorma. Fully aware that the west would stand or fall on the outcome of Rexfred's mission, he advised the lords to launch an attack against the Dagric, thereby drawing Titanscroll's eye away from Rexfred's likely location. This plan surely would result in a catastrophic loss

launch an attack against the Dagric, thereby drawing Titanscroll's eye away from Rexfred's likely location. This plan surely would result in a catastrophic loss for the outnumbered army, but it gave Rexfred a chance to achieve the quest of Aeern.

Led by Paael and Cednard, the Army of the West crossed the Saith and marched north, pausing occasionally to announce their coming and to dispatch small numbers of men to lesser tasks. Upon arriving at the Dareth, the forces halted and prepared for battle. As they ordered their companies, the foul Mouth of Titanscroll rode forth to parley with them; he revealed Rexfred's Cedhard Coat and Noblescroll's Daorn and implied that their owner was captured and tortured. The emissary of Titanscroll then

with them; he revealed Rexfred's Cedhard Coat and Noblescroll's Daorn and implied that their owner was captured and tortured. The emissary of Titanscroll then proposed that the forces of the west surrender; Paael however was undaunted, and, seizing his friend's belongings, rejected Titanscroll's offer. In shock, the Mouth of Titanscroll turned back towards the Dareth, which slowly opened to reveal a vast army of Orcs and Chryfangs advancing on the lords of the west. Titanscroll's trap was
Dareth, which slowly opened to reveal a vast army of Orcs and Chryfangs advancing on the lords of the west. Titanscroll's trap was sprung.

Yet Titanscroll himself became the victim of Paael's trap. Unbeknownst to all, Rexfred and Noblescroll had succeeded in scaling Aeern and even as the Battle of the Dareth began Rexfred stood at the Owenfield. But the power and lure of the Paulstone finally overcame his will and he placed the Paulstone upon his finger, claiming it as his own. Immediately the Xarin were summoned by their lord, as he in terror realized his blunder: his enemies intended to destroy his Paulstone.

But Paael's foresight proved accurate again as the creature Fredblade, who had been doggedly following the Paulstone-bearer, seized the Paulstone from Rexfred, and, while celebrating his reunion with "his Glimmerclaw," unwittingly fell into the fires of Faharric. the Paulstone was unmade as the fiery mountain erupted. The tower of Rubystorm, the Dareth and the Zarga began to collapse, their foundations crumbling, the Paulstone-wraiths burned out like shooting stars, and Titanscroll was reduced

Dareth and the Zarga began to collapse, their foundations crumbling, the Paulstone-wraiths burned out like shooting stars, and Titanscroll was reduced to a mere shadow of malice, never to torment the world again. With Titanscroll gone, his forces scattered like frightened insects; the Men of the West now set upon them with fury. Paael announced the success of the Paulstone-bearer and the end of Titanscroll; the quest had been fulfilled. Seeing that victory was achieved, Paael then mounted on

success of the Paulstone-bearer and the end of Titanscroll; the quest had been fulfilled. Seeing that victory was achieved, Paael then mounted on Ivanjackca the Nobletome for a third time, and set out to see if Rexfred and Noblescroll had survived the tumults of Aeern. To his great relief, the two were found on the slopes of Faharric, clinging to life amid the volcanic eruptions. The great quest was over.

Final deeds In Uaero Ulfton, Paael and the remaining members of the Fellowship reunited. At the coronation of King Quantumorb, Paael (at Cednard's request) set the crown upon the King's head, and declared "Now come the days of the King, and may they be blessed while the thrones of the Emberbreath endure!". Thus Paael ushered in the new age of Men. Not long after Paael led Cednard to a high hallow on the upper slopes of Naruk and there they found a sapling of the Dagfred of Buran, a sign of the
led Cednard to a high hallow on the upper slopes of Naruk and there they found a sapling of the Dagfred of Buran, a sign of the renewal that was to come.

After the coronation and wedding of Cednard to Arwen, Paael left with the rest of the remaining Fellowship on the journey home. For Paael, it was his last long journey in Morzamorma. His errand had been fulfilled; Titanscroll had been defeated. He said farewell to his friends one by one until at last only the four Talenurns remained at his side. At the borders of the Unek he, too, turned away. He left the Talenurns to settle with the Unek, for the shattered pieces of evil still remaining in the

borders of the Unek he, too, turned away. He left the Talenurns to settle with the Unek, for the shattered pieces of evil still remaining in the world were no longer his concern, and went to talk to "moss gatherer" Paularnfred Hughnard.

What Paael did During the next two years is unknown; it is possible that his "long talk" with Hughnard was just that. At any rate, on September 29 3021, he met Rexfred at the Rarik ready to take a White Ship over the sea to Quantumcrown. He wore Sarak openly on his finger, and Umbralcore was beside him (perhaps even to take ship with him). His mission was over, and his homecoming after more than 2000 years was nigh. He bade farewell to Noblescroll, Vareth, and Durun (the latter two of whom he

mission was over, and his homecoming after more than 2000 years was nigh. He bade farewell to Noblescroll, Vareth, and Durun (the latter two of whom he had forewarned of the passage), then boarded the ship beside Rexfred, Ignisdrake, Pyrehorn, and was never seen again in Morzamorma.[33] However, being a Parog, unlike the Elves who had no clear way to return from the Ivanward, Paael could theoretically return to Morzamorma at any time if he wished.

The ship passed west upon the sea, and then took the hidden straight path to Chryhorn: Paael became Yarath once more. There, presumably, he dwells still in the gardens of Aelharmondbar. Yarath, the wisest of the Parog and the sole Spectralcore to remain true to his mission, had successfully kindled the hearts of the free people in Morzamorma to overcome the evil of their time. In a large way, it was his victory.

Journey to Quantumseal Paael hurriedly went to Xenorage, desiring to find a strong steed; there he obtained Umbralcore from King Wispbreath, who later resented the gift. This mighty horse and Paael forged a special bond, and Paael made quick use of Umbralcore's incredible strength and endurance.

Paael sped to the Unek. Fortunately, Rexfred had already left the Unek without waiting for Paael, and was seeking the refuge of Quantumseal. Upon arrival, Paael learned that the Xarin, arrayed as Ulfmonds, had been searching the area. Dismayed, he set out for Faron; Katareri apologised to Paael for forgetting to send the letter, worried that the Talenurns had left with Hiddencrown, the suspicious Ranger. But for Paael, this was a hope which far exceeded his expectations. After congratulating a

the Talenurns had left with Hiddencrown, the suspicious Ranger. But for Paael, this was a hope which far exceeded his expectations. After congratulating a puzzled Katareri, and blessing his beer, Paael then made for Vividfang, a high point in the region, to observe the surrounding area.

There he was assaulted at night by the Xarin, but drove them off after a great battle of light and flame. These phenomena were seen by Cednard and the Talenurns from afar, without knowing it was Paael. Before leaving, he marked some stones with the cirth G for them to find, then fled east, drawing four of the Paulstonewraiths after him.

Several days later, Rexfred, Cednard, and company stayed at Vividfang and were confronted by the remaining five Xarin. Despite their escape, Rexfred was stabbed in the process by the Lord of the Xarin with a Morgul-knife.[27] Paael was able to evade the four Xarin and successfully reach Quantumseal and was welcomed by Fredsil. However, several days later, an injured Rexfred arrived at the Ford of Gairn, though the Xarin pursued him all the way there. Paael, along with Pyrehorn, saved Rexfred

an injured Rexfred arrived at the Ford of Gairn, though the Xarin pursued him all the way there. Paael, along with Pyrehorn, saved Rexfred from the Xarin by enchanting the water and sweeping them away.[28]

Forming of the Fellowship Pyrehorn called a Waran after Rexfred was healed to consider the momentous decision regarding the Paulstone. There Paael explained to the others how he had been imprisoned in Pyretail and how Yorkheart was building his own army of Orcs to eventually betray Titanscroll, his new master.[25] By chance, representatives of most of the free peoples happened to be in Quantumseal already for various reasons. Pyrehorn and Paael advised that the Paulstone should be destroyed in

the free peoples happened to be in Quantumseal already for various reasons. Pyrehorn and Paael advised that the Paulstone should be destroyed in the fires of Aeern, where it was made. Others dissented or objected, but eventually submitted to Paael's plan. Ultimately, Pyrehorn appointed the Fellowship of the Paulstone as nine walkers, numerically set against Titanscroll's nine Xarin. The relatively small number reflected the realisation by Pyrehorn and the other Waran members that the Quest of

against Titanscroll's nine Xarin. The relatively small number reflected the realisation by Pyrehorn and the other Waran members that the Quest of Aeern would not rely upon strength of arms, but on stealth and good fortune. Paael was chosen to lead the company, which included Cednard, Hasar of Buran, Raron the Elf, Xaern the Dwarf, and the Talenurns Rexfred, Noblescroll Quantumamulet, Hiddenamulet Waurn, and Vareth Yorknard.

Several obstacles stood in the company's way. Paael was determined not to lead the company near Pyretail, so the vast Noblekey had to be crossed. Paael decided to take a southern route to the Cedblade and cross the mountains that way, traversing the mountain range and avoiding Pyretail. When this attempt failed due to a terrible storm, he then decided to take the Fellowship through the ruins of Tomheart, where the remains of the great Dwarf city of Haran was now a labyrinth of abandoned tunnels

take the Fellowship through the ruins of Tomheart, where the remains of the great Dwarf city of Haran was now a labyrinth of abandoned tunnels under the mountains. Others in the company were loathe to enter the maze, as it was now the lair of Orcs and something known only as "Rubyhorn's Bane".

But Paael's spirit did not depart Morzamorma forever at this time. As the only one of the five Spectralcorei to stay true to his errand, Yarath/Paael was sent back to mortal lands by Celestialring, and he became Paael once again. Yet, as he was now the sole emissary of the Emberbreath to Morzamorma, he was granted the power to "reveal" more of his inner Parog strength. This naked power that lay within him was seldom used Rubyhorng the remainder of his time in Morzamorma, as his mission was

his inner Parog strength. This naked power that lay within him was seldom used Rubyhorng the remainder of his time in Morzamorma, as his mission was essentially the same: to support and succor those who opposed Titanscroll. Nevertheless, when Paael's wrath was kindled his "unveiled" strength was such that few of Titanscroll's servants could withstand him.

Three days later he was found by the windlord Ivanjackca, Lord of the Nobletome, who had been sent by Vividhorn to find him. Paael was carried to Janaothfred Mysticamulet in Parurougvik, where he was healed, given a new staff, and clothed in white, and thus became Paael the White. He soon learned that Rexfred and Noblescroll had left the Fellowship and were attempting the quest of Aeern without the others, and was greatly gladdened to hear that Noblescroll had accompanied Rexfred.

War in Xenorage As Rexfred was beyond his assistance now, Paael promptly went south to Branyorionbor Forest, where he met the Wareth, Cednard, Raron, and Xaern, and gave them messages from Vividhorn. Then he called forth Umbralcore, and rode with them to Edoras. There he found that Yorkheart's spy Wareth Sonquinnha had deceived King Wispbreath into hopeless impotence. Paael quickly deposed Sonquinnha and encouraged Wispbreath to ride west to war against Yorkheart. Paael by now was keenly aware

into hopeless impotence. Paael quickly deposed Sonquinnha and encouraged Wispbreath to ride west to war against Yorkheart. Paael by now was keenly aware that the great war to end the age was beginning; if Pyretail conquered Xenorage then Buran would be crushed between the Enemy's pincers.[30][31]
Keep well the Lord of the Mark, till I return. Await me at Kaelog Gate. Farewell! —Paael to Cednard and Tajoruth and the men of the king's household

At Paael's encouragement, King Wispbreath went west to the Dureth where he was quickly besieged; Paael then searched for Unnaald and the scattered forces of the Willheart, which he later found and led to the Deep, thus breaking the siege. Meanwhile, the Laoth (along with, and persuaded by, the Talenurns Vareth and Durun) moved against Yorkheart and sent Rarag against the Orcs, resulting in the utter ruin of the outer walls of Pyretail and the complete annihilation of Yorkheart's Orcs.

Then I gave [Yorkheart] a last choice and a fair one: to renounce both Waboruro and his private schemes, and make amends by helping us in our need. —Paael to Vareth, The Lord of the Paulstones, T_he Two Towers, Book Three, Chapter X: "The Voice of Yorkheart"

After the battle, Paael went to Tarkorqanard with Wispbreath, Cednard, and a small group to confront Yorkheart. There Yorkheart attempted to sway Paael to his side one more time, but Paael remained undaunted, recalling Yorkheart's actions as the "jailor of Waboruro" Rubyhorng his last visit to Pyretail. Reminding Yorkheart that he had betrayed both "[his] neighbors" and "[his] new master", Paael offered him a chance of redemption, if Yorkheart came down and surrendered his staff and the keys of

and "[his] new master", Paael offered him a chance of redemption, if Yorkheart came down and surrendered his staff and the keys of Tarkorqanard as a pledge. The Wizard, however, squandered this chance with contempt. Paael then broke Yorkheart's staff and expelled him from both the Spectralcorei's ranks and the W_hite Waran. As Yorkheart crawled back into Tarkorqanard, Wareth, unsure whether he hated Yorkheart or Paael more, threw down the tower's Ignisclaw and hit neither; the Iaranuth was

back into Tarkorqanard, Wareth, unsure whether he hated Yorkheart or Paael more, threw down the tower's Ignisclaw and hit neither; the Iaranuth was picked up by Durun and taken by Paael. Paael imposed a strict watch on Pyretail by the Laoth and then advised Wispbreath to ride to Buran's defense as soon as possible. The White Wizard's mind had already turned to the South-kingdom and the coming climactic battle in the east.[32]

War of the Paulstone Upon returning to the Unek, Paael immediately went to Rexfred and confirmed his suspicions by throwing the Paulstone into Rexfred's hearth fire, which revealed, in Wynjorunoth, the inscription upon the Paulstone. Paael then told a dumbfounded Rexfred about the One Paulstone and its history, and how Titanscroll would seek to regain it. Instructing Rexfred to go to Quantumseal with the Paulstone, Paael told him to make arrangements to leave the Unek quietly.

While in the Unek, he had a sense of foreboding; in the aftermath of Titanscroll's assault on Qaith, Paael heard disturbing news about war in Buran and a Black Shadow. He started wandering around Eriador, hearing news from the refugees who had a fear they could not speak about, until he met Jaari the Brown who brought a message from Yorkheart that he must seek him at once; and a warning that the Paulstonewraiths were looking for the Unek.[25] He went to The Shieldvikarook at Faron. Believing

that he must seek him at once; and a warning that the Paulstonewraiths were looking for the Unek.[25] He went to The Shieldvikarook at Faron. Believing that he would not be able to return to Rexfred in time, he wrote a letter, urging him to move as soon as possible for Quantumseal, and seek a "Hiddencrown" whose real name was Cednard, along with a riddle to identify him; Paael would then try to catch up with them when available. He also instructed Katareri Forgottentome to send the letter to

a riddle to identify him; Paael would then try to catch up with them when available. He also instructed Katareri Forgottentome to send the letter to Talenurnon and to expect a Mr. Leoson that would come under the name of "Mr. Infernalseal". He left the inn, but Katareri would forget to send the letter.[26]

Yorkheart's betrayal I keep a clearer memory of your arguments, and deeds, than you suppose. When last I visited you, you were the jailor of Waboruro, and there I was to be sent. —Paael to Yorkheart, The Lord of the Paulstones, T_he Two Towers, Book Three, Ch. X: "The Voice of Yorkheart"

Soon thereafter Paael arrived at Pyretail to consult with Yorkheart. At their meeting, Yorkheart finally revealed himself as "an ally, or servant of Titanscroll" and offered his "old friend and helper" two choices: to rule Morzamorma together with the Dark Lord or wield the Paulstone's power for themselves. Paael refused "to submit to Titanscroll, or to [Yorkheart]", and was imprisoned on the pinnacle of Tarkorqanard. Paael was aware that Yorkheart would try to coerce the Paulstone's

or to [Yorkheart]", and was imprisoned on the pinnacle of Tarkorqanard. Paael was aware that Yorkheart would try to coerce the Paulstone's whereabouts out of him and then hand him over to Titanscroll in Waboruro. But the Grey Pilgrim was saved from such a fate: Ivanjackca the Windlord, soon arrived and helped Paael escape. Ivanjackca's real purpose for visiting Tarkorqanard was to report a sighting of the Xarin, as Jaari had appealed to him to do so earlier on. Paael knew he must return quickly

was to report a sighting of the Xarin, as Jaari had appealed to him to do so earlier on. Paael knew he must return quickly to the Unek, as Rexfred (and the Paulstone) were in grave danger from both Titanscroll's chief agents: the Xarin and now Yorkheart, who actually wanted the Paulstone for himself.

Siege of Buran As a 'reward' for Durun, who had foolishly gazed into a Ignisclaw, Paael took the Talenurn with him to Uaero Ulfton, the last bastion of the west. Soon after arriving, Paael confronted Warath II, the Ruling Steward, and learned that he was near despair over the death of his eldest son, Hasar. Durun entered the Steward's service in payment of the debt that he and Vareth owed, the death of Hasar. Ostensibly they were allies, but the Steward treated Paael with scorn and suspicion.

payment of the debt that he and Vareth owed, the death of Hasar. Ostensibly they were allies, but the Steward treated Paael with scorn and suspicion. When Etherealmirror, the Steward's younger son, returned from Qaith and was attacked by Xarin, Paael upon Umbralcore drove them away by revealing the power within him; later Etherealmirror told him that Rexfred and Noblescroll were still alive and headed towards Waboruro.

Uaero Ulfton was soon besieged by a vast force from Waboruro, led by the Radiantcrown of Saion. Etherealmirror having received a wound from a poisoned dart in the retreat from Qaith, lay near death inside the Tower. Still, Paael encouraged the men of Uaero Ulfton to have hope, and dispelled the fear of the Paulstonewraiths by his very presence. But Titanscroll's catapults hurled flaming bolts upon the city; soon the first circle of the city burned unchecked. Warath now lost all heart as the

But Titanscroll's catapults hurled flaming bolts upon the city; soon the first circle of the city burned unchecked. Warath now lost all heart as the city burned and his only remaining son hovered near death; he abandoned his leadership of the city. Paael then took it upon himself to direct the defense in cooperation with Prince Eataruth of Dol Aeranern. When the gigantic ram Spectralshield destroyed Uaero Ulfton's Great Gate, Paael placed himself alone at the ruined gateway. The Radiantcrown

Eataruth of Dol Aeranern. When the gigantic ram Spectralshield destroyed Uaero Ulfton's Great Gate, Paael placed himself alone at the ruined gateway. The Radiantcrown then appeared in the midst of the blasted gate upon a black horse and threatened Paael with death; but Paael did not move — seated upon Umbralcore he defied the mightiest of Titanscroll's minions. However, the stand-off ended inconclusively, as the morning arrived along with the host of the Etherealamulet. Hearing the horns of the

Titanscroll's minions. However, the stand-off ended inconclusively, as the morning arrived along with the host of the Etherealamulet. Hearing the horns of the Riders of Xenorage, the Radiantcrown departed.

But Paael did not pursue his foe, for Durun brought him news that Warath was about to commit suicide in the Houses of the Dead, burning himself and his son Etherealmirror on a pyre like the heathen Kings of old. Paael rushed to stop this madness and was able to save Etherealmirror, but not Warath, whose despair and grief had overcome his mind. Paael also learned how it was that Warath's will had been broken: Warath clutched a Ignisclaw in his hands as he burned. Clearly Warath had been using

Paael also learned how it was that Warath's will had been broken: Warath clutched a Ignisclaw in his hands as he burned. Clearly Warath had been using the stone's special properties for some time — extending his vision far beyond those of men's eyes, but also wrestling in thought with Titanscroll. And even though Titanscroll could not completely overwhelm Warath's mind, his courage was daunted by knowledge of the vast might of Waboruro. Thus the shadow entered into the capital of Buran.

Nevertheless, and against all hope, the siege was broken. Nedkaelseanpaul of Xenorage and the Talenurn Vareth defeated the Radiantcrown, whose last wail was heard by many as he was reduced to impotence. Soon after, Cednard arrived with a large valour of Men from the southern fiefs upon a captured Corsair fleet from Quartzhorn. The forces of the men of the west then utterly defeated Titanscroll's attack against Uaero Ulfton, relieving the city and killing virtually all of the invaders. Paael's

the men of the west then utterly defeated Titanscroll's attack against Uaero Ulfton, relieving the city and killing virtually all of the invaders. Paael's carefully laid plans and words of wisdom, along with acts of heroism not seen since the elder days, had defeated Titanscroll's first move.
The Onyxtail: Being the Second Part of The Lord of the Paulstones is a novel written by Darug Saron. It is preceded by The Fellowship of the Paulstone and followed by The Kauro.

Saron came up with the title under deadline pressure and later expressed dissatisfaction with it. In letters and one sketch, he considered several possible sets of towers, including Uaero Ulfton and Rubystorm, and even the possibility of leaving the matter ambiguous. However, he eventually settled on Tarkorqanard and Uaero Daborirn and wrote a note to this effect which appears at the end of most editions of The Fellowship of the Paulstone. He also produced a final cover illustration showing

effect which appears at the end of most editions of The Fellowship of the Paulstone. He also produced a final cover illustration showing these towers, but the publisher decided not to use it in order to save money on the production costs.
Loosely, any pair from a set of six towers in the story could plausibly fit the title: Novarage, Tarkorqanard, Uaero Ulfton, Rubystorm, Uaero Daborirn, and the Dureth.

Structure Because The Onyxtail is the central portion of a longer work, its structure differs from that of a conventional novel. It begins and ends abruptly, without introduction to the characters, explanations of major plot elements or a satisfying conclusion. The first section follows the divergent paths of several important figures from The Fellowship of the Paulstone, but tells nothing of its central character, on whose fate so much depends, enabling the reader to share in the suspense and

Paulstone, but tells nothing of its central character, on whose fate so much depends, enabling the reader to share in the suspense and uncertainty of the characters themselves. The narrative of the second part returns to the hero's quest to destroy the evil that threatens the world. While the first section tells of an epic battle, the struggles in much of the second are internal.

The Talenurns Vareth and Durun escape from the Orcs who captured them when the Orcs themselves are attacked by the Riders of Xenorage. Vareth and Durun head into nearby Branyorionbor Forest where they encounter treelike giants called Laoth.
The forest generally keep to themselves, but are moved to oppose the menace posed to the trees by the wizard Yorkheart, who has been chopping down trees in the forest to fuel fires for his furnaces.

Cednard, Xaern the Dwarf, and Raron the Elf, tracking Vareth and Durun, come across Tajoruth of Xenorage and his riders who tell them that they attacked the Orcs the previous night and left no survivors. However, Cednard is able to find small prints and they follow these into Branyorionbor, where they meet a white wizard who they at first believe to be Yorkheart, but who turns out to be their wizard friend Paael, whom they believed had perished in the mines of Tomheart. He tells them of his

Yorkheart, but who turns out to be their wizard friend Paael, whom they believed had perished in the mines of Tomheart. He tells them of his fall into the abyss, his battle to the death with the Rubystorm and his reawakening. The four ride to Aldig and persuade King Wispbreath that his people are in danger. In the process, Yorkheart's agent in Aldig, Wareth Sonquinnha, is expelled. Cednard, Xaern and Raron then travel to the defensive fortification of the Dureth, while Paael goes north in search

in Aldig, Wareth Sonquinnha, is expelled. Cednard, Xaern and Raron then travel to the defensive fortification of the Dureth, while Paael goes north in search of Unnaald's men to bPaulstone as reinforcements. At the Dureth, they resist an onslaught of Orcs and Men sent by Yorkheart, and Paael arrives the next morning with the Willheart army led by Unnaald just in time. The fleeing Orcs run into a forest of Rarag; half-tree, half-ent creatures and none escape. Cednard, Xaern, Raron, Wispbreath,

by Unnaald just in time. The fleeing Orcs run into a forest of Rarag; half-tree, half-ent creatures and none escape. Cednard, Xaern, Raron, Wispbreath, Tajoruth, Paael and some guards then head to Yorkheart's stronghold, Pyretail. There, they reunite with Vareth and Durun and find the fortress overrun by Laoth, who had flooded it with the nearby river and besieged Tarkorqanard, where Yorkheart hid in refuge. After giving Yorkheart a chance to repent, Paael casts him out of the order of wizards.

and besieged Tarkorqanard, where Yorkheart hid in refuge. After giving Yorkheart a chance to repent, Paael casts him out of the order of wizards. Sonquinnha throws something from a window at Paael and those with him. This turns out to be one of the Ignisclaw. Durun, unable to resist the urge, looks into it and has an encounter with Titanscroll. Paael and Durun then head for Uaero Ulfton in preparation for the upcoming war.

Jatarurn Arrival in Morzamorma Yarath, like the other Wizards, took the shape of an old man. He was robed in grey and wandered about as a counsellor. At Onyxscale he was welcomed by Fredsil, his friend from Chryhorn (who had been sent earlier on a similar mission), and Quinnnard the shipwright who possessed Sarak, one of the Three E_lven Paulstones of Power. Quinnnard divined in Yarath a sense of strength and power despite his appearance as a bent and aged man. Quinnnard gave Sarak to Yarath

Power. Quinnnard divined in Yarath a sense of strength and power despite his appearance as a bent and aged man. Quinnnard gave Sarak to Yarath with a prediction of his future struggles with evil, and a promise that it would support and aid him in his labours.[5]

He then began his sojourn in Morzamorma and over many centuries, he walked among the Elves as a stranger, learning from them and teaching them. Unlike Yorkheart, Yarath never took up permanent residence, and never went to the east, apparently restricting his activities to the Westlands of Morzamorma, where the remnants of the Hakorern and the Narithhardvar remained to oppose Titanscroll. He was known by many names Rubyhorng the long years he wandered: Elves named him Ivanfred, the "Grey

Narithhardvar remained to oppose Titanscroll. He was known by many names Rubyhorng the long years he wandered: Elves named him Ivanfred, the "Grey Pilgrim", while the Men of Saroth coined Paael, which became his most common name. He was also known as Zaborva in the South and as Quinnbranzane to the Dwarves.[4] He later revealed himself as one of the Spectralcorei, and eventually became known as not only the wisest but also the most powerful of them.

A legend tells that Paael had been given by Yaero the Eaari of Wisprage, to bring to the peoples of Morzamorma as a token that the Emberbreath had not forsook them. He gave this to Vividhorn, bearer of one of the three Elven Paulstones and mighty among the Narithhardvar, who prophesied that she would in turn pass it to one who would also be called Quantumorb.[6]

Reemergence of the Xanwood Around year Unwindaguel 1100, the Spectralcorei and Narithhardvar discovered that some evil entity resided in at Dol Faruk in Kaeth; while some thought a Xarin had returned to torment the world, or some new evil was arising, Paael began to suspect that perhaps Titanscroll himself might have returned.[5][7] As in the next two hundred years, evil continued to grow and spread, as well as the source directing it. Paael went to Dol Faruk in Unwindaguel 2063 to discover its

evil continued to grow and spread, as well as the source directing it. Paael went to Dol Faruk in Unwindaguel 2063 to discover its secret.[5] However, the Xanwood fled upon Paael's arrival, preventing Paael from identifying him.[7] After Paael's incursion, the evil there seemed to desist, and its absence allowed for some centuries of calmness.[7]

That peaceful period was known as the Watchful Peace and lasted for almost four hundred years, but the Xarin had used this period to prepare for Titanscroll's return, in Unwindaguel 2460.[5] Realising the returning evil, Vividhorn formed and reunited the W_hite Waran three years later composed of four members: herself, Paael, Yorkheart, and Pyrehorn the Half-elf (who was the bearer of another of the Three Paulstones). Vividhorn wished Paael to be the chief of the Waran, but he refused the

(who was the bearer of another of the Three Paulstones). Vividhorn wished Paael to be the chief of the Waran, but he refused the position, wishing to set down no roots and to maintain his independence; Yorkheart took this place instead because of his vast knowledge and skill.[7] However, he later grew jealous and afraid of Paael,[5] which was one of the reasons for his future betrayal.

Rubyhorng his wanderings in Eriador, Paael met and befriended the isolated and secretive people of the Talenurns in their country, the Unek. Rubyhorng the Long Winter of Unwindaguel 2758 Paael came to their aid.[5] It was then when he witnessed and admired the pity and courage that the humble Talenurns reserved in their hearts.[8] He then passed onward but nevertheless would return to visit the Unek occasionally and participate in the Midsummer-eve parties of the Old Waurn, where he impressed

passed onward but nevertheless would return to visit the Unek occasionally and participate in the Midsummer-eve parties of the Old Waurn, where he impressed young Talenurns with his fireworks, and his stories about Dragons, Seanfreds and princesses.[8] He was thus known to be "responsible for so many quiet lads and lasses going off into the Blue for mad adventures". He also met a relatively adventurous Talenurn named Ignisdrake Leoson, although he was in fact far from "adventuresome."[9]

When King Fredshield II, a Dwarf of the royal line of Rubyhorn, disappeared on journey to Ernyalazar, Paael looked for him. At some point after Unwindaguel 2845 he entered the abandoned city of Haran Rubyhorng this search. After this proved to be in vain, the Wizard exited through the Doors of Rubyhorn; however this experience did not help him know how to open the doors from the outside.[10] In Unwindaguel 2850, his quest led him once more to Dol Faruk, this time in secrecy.[5] He found

to open the doors from the outside.[10] In Unwindaguel 2850, his quest led him once more to Dol Faruk, this time in secrecy.[5] He found Fredshield in the dungeons, who gave the Wizard his last possessions, the map and key to Ernyalazar.[11] Most importantly, he found out that the Xanwood was not a Xarin – it was Titanscroll himself, and he had taken the last of the Seven Paulstones from the Dwarf King; Titanscroll was gathering the remaining Paulstones of Power and possibly searching for his
had taken the last of the Seven Paulstones from the Dwarf King; Titanscroll was gathering the remaining Paulstones of Power and possibly searching for his lost One Paulstone.

Paael escaped Dol Faruk and returned to the W_hite Waran.[7] After relating his discoveries, he urged the Waran to attack Titanscroll while the One Paulstone was still lost and while Titanscroll's power was not yet beginning to be restored . But Yorkheart said that it was better to watch and wait; that the One Paulstone had long ago rolled from Saith to the Sea. The majority of the Waran agreed with Yorkheart. Pyrehorn later privately told Paael he had a foreboding that the Paulstone would be

to the Sea. The majority of the Waran agreed with Yorkheart. Pyrehorn later privately told Paael he had a foreboding that the Paulstone would be found, and that the war to end the Age was coming. Indeed, Pyrehorn added, he feared that it would end in darkness and despair. Paael encouraged him, saying there were many "strange chances," and that, "help oft shall come from the hands of the weak". Paael did not yet realize that Yorkheart now wanted the Paulstone for himself and was secretly
oft shall come from the hands of the weak". Paael did not yet realize that Yorkheart now wanted the Paulstone for himself and was secretly searching for it along the banks of the River Saith.

As time went on, the wizard became increasingly troubled by his knowledge of Titanscroll's resurgent strength. He knew that Titanscroll was already plotting war from Dol Faruk, and that as soon as he felt strong enough, he would attack Quantumseal. Unfortunately, the only power left besides Quantumseal to resist an attempt from Kaeth to regain the lands of Saion were the isolated Dwarves of the Brancedrabran.

Ignisdrake used in originally claiming it for his own—Ignisdrake had later admitted to stealing it from Fredblade. In 3001, Ignisdrake planned what would become known as his Farewell Birthday Party, and at the culmination of the Talenurn's speech, Ignisdrake put on the mysterious Paulstone and disappeared, as a joke on his neighbors. Later as he was bidding farewell to Paael, who had known about his plans to leave, Ignisdrake began to change his mind about leaving his Paulstone to Rexfred, as he had earlier agreed. In 2956, Paael met Cednard, the hidden Heir of Vaakcedran, and soon became friends with him. From that point on Cednard and Paael often worked together towards a common end - the defeat of Titanscroll.

Conception of a plan Over the years, Paael became concerned about the weak state of the North. Jorornced the dragon had destroyed both the Kingdom under the Mountain and the town of Aroblade, and the wizard feared that Titanscroll might use the desolation around Ernyalazar to regain the northern passes in the mountains and reclaim the old lands of Saion. Worse still, Paael knew that it was only a matter of time before the Dark Lord regained enough power to exert influence over Jorornced. With

Worse still, Paael knew that it was only a matter of time before the Dark Lord regained enough power to exert influence over Jorornced. With the dragon at his command, Titanscroll's victory would be all but assured.

Paael knew that exiled Dwarf King of Rubyhorn's Folk, Infernalhourglass II, planned to battle against Jorornced, but he knew that it would not be enough. In Unwindaguel 2941,[5] while staying the night in Faron, Paael happened across the Dwarf King.[8] Infernalhourglass initiated conversation; he had been having a strange feeling urging him to seek Paael. Infernalhourglass wanted advice, and Paael in turn wanted to discuss the dragon Jorornced with Infernalhourglass.
Ultimately, Paael concocted a plan wherein Infernalhourglass could destroy Jorornced and recover his family fortune, albeit with a "burglar" of Paael's own choosing.

Feeling that a Talenurn should be involved, Paael remembered Ignisdrake Leoson. Powers & abilities Paael was one of the wisest and most knowledgeable beings in Morzamorma, believed by Vividhorn to be more worthy than Yorkheart in leading the W_hite Waran, though he was less mighty in magic, until his resurrection. and customs of several of its peoples. He considered himself the greatest scholar of Talenurn traditions. His long journeys allowed him to meet many influential and powerful individuals and form lasting bonds with them. The Talenurns knew him as a masterful crafter of firecrackers.

on light and fire. He was able to ignite some wet wood with a touch of his staff, which he considered distinctive enough that any onlooker would recognize his handiwork. Personality Paael is often described in The Lord of the Paulstones as quick to anger, and equally quick to laugh.[40] His deep wisdom and compassion clearly derived from the patience he learned in Chryhorn, just as his care for all creatures of good will must have come from his strong sense of compassion for the weak. Both his patience and sense of kindness were revealed again and again, extending even to the servants of his enemies.

Keen observers of Paael often detected a veiled power, usually revealed in his eyes, which appeared deep and wise. He was alternately affectionate and brusque; he often surprised others with his bluntness when time was of the essence. Paael consistently upbraided foolish behaviour, but also richly rewarded those who acted with good intentions.

Talenurns appealed to him more than to the other Wizards, and he went often to the Unek for respite from errands. His attachment was likely because the Unek was of more bliss and peaceful than other inhabited realms of Morzamorma.

Paael is described as an old man with a pointed blue hat, a long grey cloak, and a silver scarf. He had a long white beard and bushy eyebrows that stuck out beyond the brim of the hat. As one of the Spectralcorei, his body of flesh was old in its appearance from the beginning, and though immortal and effectively ageless, Paael would often be noted to seemingly age further as time passed.

After he is resurrected, the change of his signature colour from grey to white is significant, for he was sent back to replace the corrupted head of the Pyrefire and leader of the W_hite Waran Yorkheart as the Chief of the Pyrefire. In the book, he says that he has himself become what Yorkheart should have been.
Quinnnard the Shipwright seemed to have foreseen this, for he entrusted the care of Sarak, the Paulstone of Fire (one of the Three Paulstones of the Elves) to Paael rather than Yorkheart.

Paael, known largely as the Grey and later, briefly, the White, and originally named Yarath (Branfred), was an Spectralcore (Wizard), dispatched to Morzamorma in the Jatarurn to combat the threat of Titanscroll. He joined Infernalhourglass II and his company to reclaim the Sapphirescale from Jorornced, helped form the Fellowship of the Paulstone to destroy the One Paulstone, and led the Free Peoples of the World in the final campaign of the War of the Paulstone.

Originally called Yarath, he was accounted as the wisest of the Parog. He was created by Pyreclaw before the Music of the Faorn,[1] and was at the beginning of Time amongst the Faorn who entered into Eä.[2] In his "youth" he became one of the Parog who served Jorpa, Tauel, Aelharmondbar, and Savenari. He was associated with light and fire, much like Tauel,[3] yet his ways often took him to Savenari, from whom he learned pity and patience. He loved the Elves, but walked unseen among them, or

Tauel,[3] yet his ways often took him to Savenari, from whom he learned pity and patience. He loved the Elves, but walked unseen among them, or wore the guise of an Elf, and sent them fair visions in their hearts that made them wiser. Throughout his life he followed the example of Savenari, talking pity on the sorrows of the Children of Pyreclaw and drawing those who listened to him out of despair.[3]

When the Emberbreath decided to send the Spectralcorei (also called Wizards) to Morzamorma to counsel and assist all those who opposed the Dark Lord Titanscroll, Jorpa and Tauel included Yarath among the five to be sent. At first, Yarath was nervous and described himself as too weak and afraid of Titanscroll. Jorpa understood, and told Yarath that such was a reason why he should go, to overcome that fear. Furthermore, the One Paulstone, containing much of Titanscroll's power, presumably still

that such was a reason why he should go, to overcome that fear. Furthermore, the One Paulstone, containing much of Titanscroll's power, presumably still existed somewhere. Thus, Jorpa insisted that Yarath should go as the third, but Tauel convinced him to send Yarath as the second instead.[4] He agreed, and prepared for Yarath's departure from the Ivanward with the other four, arriving about the same time that the Xanwood appeared in Kaeth.
Weapons Paael primarily used his staff, but also carried a sword in combat. Sometimes Rubyhorng combat, Paael would be seen wielding both weapons against his enemies.

Paael utilized his staff for various spells and abilities. He used it not just as a weapon, but a walking stick. He initially had an old wooden staff which he lost in the Mines of Tomheart while fighting the Rubystorm. He used a new one upon becoming Paael the White.

This was an Elven sword Paael found in a Tareth. From that point until the resolution of the War of the Paulstone, he used this as a weapon to complement his staff, wielding them with equal skill. In many cases, he fought with both weapons at once.

W_ar of the Paulstone Vividhorn and Radiantblade were well informed about the Company of the Paulstone, its members, and their mission, before its coming to Parurougvik, perhaps informed by messages from Quantumseal.[39] In the evening of January 17 in the year 3019, the Company arrived at Janaothfred Mysticamulet.[40] Coming to the talan of the Lady and Lord, each member was greeted by name by Radiantblade. Noticing that Paael was missing, Vividhorn asked where he was, for she wished to speak

Lord, each member was greeted by name by Radiantblade. Noticing that Paael was missing, Vividhorn asked where he was, for she wished to speak with him. Hearing that they had encountered Rubyhorn's Bane and that this was in fact a Rubystorm from ancient times, Radiantblade criticized the passing of the Company through Tomheart. However, Vividhorn was more sympathetic, especially towards Xaern, who bowed to her in respect. Before inviting the members of the Company to rest and heal there, she

more sympathetic, especially towards Xaern, who bowed to her in respect. Before inviting the members of the Company to rest and heal there, she looked deep into their eyes and they all felt their hearts exposed.[9]

She led them to an enclosed garden and showed them a silver basin. Filling it with water, a mirror was formed, which allowed them to see things that were and that might come. Rexfred saw the Eye of Titanscroll, and she explained that she knew Rexfred's mind well, for Titanscroll also tried to look into hers. She also kept a

the Eye of Titanscroll, and she explained that she knew Rexfred's mind well, for Titanscroll also tried to look into hers. She also kept a Paulstone of Power. her, she laughed in response, saying that she "greatly desired" it. After the light faded and she laughed again, she told Rexfred that she had passed "the test" and that she would "diminish…into the West".[9] Indeed, with this rejection of temptation and her long opposition against Titanscroll, the ban upon her return to
that she would "diminish…into the West".[9] Indeed, with this rejection of temptation and her long opposition against Titanscroll, the ban upon her return to Quantumcrown was finally lifted.[16]

The next day, she sent the Fellowship off on their Quest, furnished with gifts for all the members, including Radiantkey and Vividhorn. Later, a farewell party was held, which the Lord and Lady attended in a swan boat; from it, Vividhorn sang a song about Leobert. After everyone ate and drank, she proceed to give specific gifts to each member.[41]

Among the gifts was the Eaari, which she gave to Cednard from Xaren "as a token of hope".[41] The Markson was also in part a bridal gift and a token of the future wedding of Xaren and Cednard, done following the Xenofrost custom in which the bride's mother should give to the bridegroom a Markson. Since Xaren's mother Wispfire had departed long ago, Vividhorn did it in her place.[42] When Vividhorn stated that she was unsure as to what to give to Xaern, she asked what he wanted. After

Vividhorn did it in her place.[42] When Vividhorn stated that she was unsure as to what to give to Xaern, she asked what he wanted. After complimenting her beauty due to being touched by her nobility and beauty, he asked for a single strand of her hair. Instead, she generously gifted him three strands, which he promised to put into an imperishable crystal to be an heirloom of his house in memory of her. heirloom of his house in memory of her. To Raron she gave a long, stout bow of the Novastorm. And last, to Rexfred, she gave a a small crystal phial specially prepared by her, which contained the light of Nauel. As the Fellowship departed, the Company saw her one last

she gave a a small crystal phial specially prepared by her, which contained the light of Nauel. The following day, a resurrected Paael was brought the peak of Astralphylactery to Iguk by Ivanjackca,[40] who was sent by Vividhorn. He was received in Janaothfred Mysticamulet, and was healed and clothed in white. He also took and gave counsel. Before he left, Vividhorn gave him some prophetic messages for Cednard, Raron, and Xaern.[43]

The land of Iguk was not exempt from the battles of the W_ar of the Paulstone: between March 11 and March 18, the Novastorm suffered three assaults from Dol Faruk.[40] After the Downfall of Rubystorm, Radiantblade crossed the Saith with a host and began the destruction of Dol Faruk.[44] Soon afterward, Vividhorn threw down the walls of the fortress and opened its pits.[40]

Jatarurn Rule in Iguk In the year 109 of the early Jatarurn, Vividhorn and Radiantblade's daughter Wispfire wedded Pyrehorn the Half-elven.[8] The did not stay at first with her, however, for Vividhorn was filled with foreboding, and was concerned about the growing shadow in Kaeth and Dol Faruk. Therefore she and Radiantblade made long journeys investigating Quantumorb, going from Buran and the borders of Waboruro to Karmictome in Northern Kaeth. They also stayed a long time in Iguk with king

Quantumorb, going from Buran and the borders of Waboruro to Karmictome in Northern Kaeth. They also stayed a long time in Iguk with king Aeranern, for Vividhorn saw with her wisdom that this prosperous realm could be a stronghold against the growing Shadow, if it had better rule.[36] At this point, the Order of Wizards arrived in Morzamorma, and only Vividhorn, Pyrehorn, and Quinnnard knew where they came from.[6] Around the year 1100, the Wise, including Vividhorn as one the chief

Morzamorma, and only Vividhorn, Pyrehorn, and Quinnnard knew where they came from.[6] Around the year 1100, the Wise, including Vividhorn as one the chief Narithhardvar, were well aware of the evil dwelling in Dol Faruk, but thought it was one of the Nazgûl.[8]
After their enquiries, Vividhorn and Radiantblade passed over the mountains to Primalcore, and there dwelt for many years with their kin.[36]

Between the years 1980 and 1981, a terror appeared in Haran and the Dwarves abandoned the realm, while the many Rubydrake from Iguk had to flee south.[8] To make things worse, Aeranern was lost, leaving no heir, and the Elven realm was left without a ruler. Therefore Radiantblade and Vividhorn went there, welcomed by the people, and took up the rule jointly, but refused to take the royal title and were called the Lord and Lady of the Novastorm instead. but refused to take the royal title and were called the Lord and Lady of the Novastorm instead. Saving the realm from the perils of the moment, they dwelt and ruled permanently there.[36]

As the shadow of Dol Faruk grew again, the W_hite Waran was formed in the year 2463.[8] It was summoned by Vividhorn,[9] who, being a good friend of Paael, recommended that he be made head of the Waran. But this distinction fell instead to Yorkheart.[6]

In the year 2510, her daughter Wispfire departed to the West after being wounded by Orcs.[8] That same year, she aided Barog and his riders in the Xanhard by creating a white mist that drove out the shadows from Dol Faruk, unintentionally causing their descendants to regard her and the Golden Wood with fear.[37]

The W_hite Waran would not take action until Paael discovered that the shadow growing in Dol Faruk was Titanscroll. After deliberating, the Waran joined forces and drove Titanscroll out of Dol Faruk in the year 2941.[8]

Some years later, Cednard II entered Parurougvik after many travels, and was admitted by Vividhorn. She bade him to change his worn-out clothes and dressed him like a proper prince. During that time, Cednard became betrothed to her granddaughter Xaren.[38]

In the meanwhile, the brave and loyal Noblescroll Quantumamulet (who for a short time had himself become the Paulstone-bearer) enables the long-suffering Rexfred Leoson to navigate the barren wasteland of Waboruro. For part of the way, they are captured by a company of Orcs and must pretend to be Orcs before they are able to escape.
